    • Constructor Detail

      • Gamma

        public Gamma()

    • Method Detail

      • logGamma

        public static double logGamma(double x)
        log Gamma function: log(gamma(alpha)) for alpha bigger than 0, accurate to 10 decimal places

        Reference: Pike MC & Hill ID (1966) Algorithm 291: Logarithm of the gamma function. Communications of the Association for Computing Machinery, 9:684

        Parameters:
        x - parameter of the gamma function
        Returns:
        the log of the gamma function of the given alpha

      • gamma

        public static double gamma(double x)
        The Gamma function is defined by:

        Gamma(x) = integral( t^(x-1) e^(-t), t = 0 .. infinity)

        Uses Lanczos approximation formula.

        Parameters:
        x - parameter of the gamma function
        Returns:
        gamma function of the given alpha

      • digamma

        public static double digamma(double x)
        digamma(x) = d log Gamma(x)/ dx
        Parameters:
        x - parameter of the gamma function
        Returns:
        derivative of the gamma function

      • invDigamma

        public static double invDigamma(double y)
        Newton iteration to solve digamma(x)-y = 0.
        Parameters:
        y - parameter y in the function above
        Returns:
        the inverse function of digamma, i.e., returns x such that digamma(x) = y adapted from Tony Minka fastfit Matlab code
